products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-account-infra-base
products.label: Account Infrastructure Base
products.short_description: Creates and configures the base layer components of an IBM Cloud account according to best practices
products.long_description: The Account Infrastructure Base architecture supports creating and configuring the foundational components of an IBM Cloud account. This includes IAM account settings, Activity Tracker routing, Cloud Objects Storage, a trusted profile and associated access groups, and the resource group in which all resources are provisioned.

features.title: Configures IAM account settings
features.description: Configures IAM account settings to meet FSCloud compliance requirements.

features.title: Creates Activity Tracker route and target
features.description: Creates Activity Tracker route and target to send events to a COS bucket.

features.title: Creates access controls
features.description: Creates a trusted profile and the associated access group to provide secure authenticaiton for applications.

features.title: Creates a resource group
features.description: Creates the resource group where all resources that are created by this solution are provisioned.

profiles.profile_name: IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services

architecture.descriptions: The Account Infrastructure Base architecture provides a standardized approach to setting up cloud accounts. The architecture includes configurations for IAM settings and access controls, helping to enforce security best practices. Activity Tracker routes events to a Cloud Object Storage bucket to monitor resource creation, modification, and access within an account. You can use this architecture as a base for deploying additional services and resources in different types of accounts, such as administrative or workload accounts.
